Detailed Description

This class is a simple wrapper around a block of binary data.

It is designed to be used so that blocks of memory can be reference counted and passed around with smart pointers.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

BinaryBlock::BinaryBlock ( const void *  data,
int  len,
const char *  allocator,
BinaryPtr  pOwner = 0 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
data Pointer to a block of data
len Size of the data block
allocator A string describing the allocator of this object.
pOwner A smart pointer to the owner of this data. If not NULL, a reference is kept to the owner, otherwise a copy of the data is taken.

Member Function Documentation

void BinaryBlock::canZip ( bool  newVal  ) 

This method allows specifying that a binary block should not be recompressed.

For example, an image stored as a binary block shouldn't be recompressed externally (it would just make things slower).

Parameters:
newVal True if external compression can help, false otherwise.

bool BinaryBlock::canZip (  )  const

This method returns whether or not it makes sense to compress this binary block (for example, if it's compressed already, don't recompress).

Returns:
True if external compression can help, false otherwise.

char* BinaryBlock::cdata (  )  [inline]

const char* BinaryBlock::cdata (  )  const [inline]

BinaryPtr BinaryBlock::compress ( int  level = DEFAULT_COMPRESSION  )  const

Return a compressed version of the block.

Parameters:
level The level of compression, 0 to 10, with 0 no compression (quickest) and 10 full compression (slowest).
Returns:
The compressed block.

const void* BinaryBlock::data (  )  const [inline]

This method returns a pointer to the block of binary data.

BinaryPtr BinaryBlock::decompress (  )  const

Decompress the block.

Returns:
The uncompressed block. If the block was not compressed then NULL is returned.

bool BinaryBlock::isCompressed (  )  const

This checks whether the block is likely to be compressed.

We do this by checking for our zip magic header. It's possible but unlikely that a BinaryBlock is not compressed but has the header.

Returns:
True if the block has the compressed header.

int BinaryBlock::len (  )  const [inline]

This method returns the length of the binary data.
